intro: Notylia arachnites, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to parts of Australia. It is a small, terrestrial orchid with a distinctive inflorescence that resembles a spider, giving it its common name. The plant produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Notylia arachnites typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, sunny conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in conservation areas and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
